intro: Anthodon verrucosum, commonly known as the rough anthodium, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of fine, woolly hairs. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in a compact inflorescence, often resembling a dandelion. Anthodon verrucosum is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
